dt: {bc}an interval of time during which a sequence of a recurring succession of events or phenomena is completed
{bc}a course or series of events or operations that recur regularly and usually lead back to the starting point

dt.t: … the common {wi}cycle{/wi} of birth, growth, senescence, and death.

aq.auth: T. C. Schneirla and Gerard Piel

dt: {bc}one complete performance of a vibration, electric oscillation, current alternation, or other periodic process
{bc}a permutation of a set of ordered elements in which each element takes the place of the next and the last becomes first
{bc}a takeoff and landing of an airplane
{bc}a circular or spiral arrangement: such as
{bc}an imaginary circle or orbit in the heavens
{bc}a group of creative works (such as poems, plays, or songs) treating the same theme

dt.t: a {wi}cycle{/wi} of poems about unrequited love

dt: {bc}a series of narratives dealing typically with the exploits of a legendary hero
{bc}the series of a single, double, triple, and home run hit in any order by one player during one baseball game

et: Middle English {it}cicle{/it}, from Late Latin {it}cyclus{/it}, from Greek {it}kyklos{/it} circle, wheel, cycle {ma}{mat|wheel|}{/ma}
shortdef: an interval of time during which a sequence of a recurring succession of events or phenomena is completed
a course or series of events or operations that recur regularly and usually lead back to the starting point
one complete performance of a vibration, electric oscillation, current alternation, or other periodic process

dt.t: The menu {wi}cycles{/wi} through all the options.
Because the traditional HVAC system {wi}cycles{/wi} on and off—and is powered down when you leave—relief is inconsistent at best.
Freezing temperatures … aren't the problem. It's when temperatures {wi}cycle{/wi} between freezing and thaws, causing pavement to contract and expand … that can create larger issues.

dt: {bc}to cause to go through a cycle

dt.t: The fact that it [the pump] runs constantly may be a bad sign. It may be {wi}cycling{/wi} the water, not removing it.
Everything is constantly {wi}cycled{/wi} in nature. There is abundant waste in nature, just as there is in industry, but in nature waste constantly flows back into living systems.

shortdef: to ride a cycle; specifically : bicycle

dt: {bc}a cycle of economic activity usually consisting of recession, recovery, growth, and decline

shortdef: a cycle of economic activity usually consisting of recession, recovery, growth, and decline

dt: {bc}the cycle of enzyme-catalyzed dark reactions of photosynthesis that occurs in the chloroplasts of plants and in many bacteria and that involves the fixation of carbon dioxide and the formation of a 6-carbon sugar

shortdef: the cycle of enzyme-catalyzed dark reactions of photosynthesis that occurs in the chloroplasts of plants and in many bacteria and that involves the fixation of carbon dioxide and the formation of a 6-carbon sugar

dt: {bc}the cycle of carbon in the earth's ecosystems in which carbon dioxide is fixed by photosynthetic organisms to form organic nutrients and is ultimately restored to the inorganic state (as by respiration, protoplasmic decay, or combustion)

{bc}a cycle of thermonuclear reactions in which four hydrogen atoms synthesize into a helium atom by the catalytic action of carbon with the release of nuclear energy and which is held to be the source of most of the energy radiated by the sun and stars

shortdef: the cycle of carbon in the earth's ecosystems in which carbon dioxide is fixed by photosynthetic organisms to form organic nutrients and is ultimately restored to the inorganic state (as by respiration, protoplasmic decay, or combustion)

a cycle of thermonuclear reactions in which four hydrogen atoms synthesize into a helium atom by the catalytic action of carbon with the release of nuclear energy and which is held to be the source of most of the energy radiated by the sun and stars

dt: {bc}the complete series of events from one cell division to the next {dx}compare {dxt|g{inf}1{/inf} phase||}, {dxt|g{inf}2{/inf} phase||}, {dxt|m phase||}, {dxt|s phase||}{/dx}

shortdef: the complete series of events from one cell division to the next

dt: {bc}the correlated phenomena of the endocrine and reproductive systems of a female mammal from the beginning of one period of estrus to the beginning of the next

shortdef: the correlated phenomena of the endocrine and reproductive systems of a female mammal from the beginning of one period of estrus to the beginning of the next —called also estral cycle, estrus cycle

dt: {bc}the sequence of conditions through which water passes from vapor in the atmosphere through precipitation upon land or water surfaces and ultimately back into the atmosphere as a result of evaporation and transpiration

shortdef: the sequence of conditions through which water passes from vapor in the atmosphere through precipitation upon land or water surfaces and ultimately back into the atmosphere as a result of evaporation and transpiration —called also hydrological cycle, water cycle

dt: {bc}the series of stages in form and functional activity through which an organism passes between successive recurrences of a specified primary stage
{bc}a series of stages through which something (such as an individual, culture, or manufactured product) passes during its lifetime

shortdef: the series of stages in form and functional activity through which an organism passes between successive recurrences of a specified primary stage
a series of stages through which something (such as an individual, culture, or manufactured product) passes during its lifetime
